channel.title: FireFox 3 beta testing
channel.description:
[quote="The Edge of I-Hacked"]Thanks for the tip Rutilus Mozilla has officially released the first public alpha build of Firefox 3.0. Codenamed Gran Paradiso, Firefox 3 includes the new Gecko 1.9 rendering engine which leverages the open-source Cairo rendering framework and features heavily refactored reflow algorithms that improve Firefox layout functionality and resolve some long-standing CSS bugs.
A First Look: http://arstechnica.com/news.ars/post/20061212-8409.html
Download Link: http://releases.mozilla.org/pub/mozilla.org/firefox/releases/granparadiso/alpha1/ http://releases.mozilla.org/pub/mozilla.org/firefox/releases/granparadiso/alpha1/win32/en-US/Gran%20Paradiso%20Setup%20Alpha%201.exe[/quote]
Just thought I'd share the news.

item.title: FireFox 3 beta testing
item.dc:creator: @dark_child dark_child
item.description:
@dark_child wrote:

[quote=“BloodRayne, post:2, topic:35521”]Hmm ill check it out… Usually theres lots of glitches in betas though, right?[/quote]well according to this it already had a bug in 2
heavily refactored reflow algorithms that improve Firefox layout functionality and resolve some long-standing CSS bugs.

Read full topic

item.title: FireFox 3 beta testing
item.dc:creator: @leader leader
item.description:
@leader wrote:

cruel:

v2 just came out, why’re they going straight to v3 with such [relatively] minor changes?

They will probably release it within 2-6 months. They only make minor changes right now, but will make more changes later. Companies release later versions of the product, because they enhance the program’s performance, and make it a little better. It is best to start working on a new version right away so you can fully test it, see what needs to be changed, and release it when it is done. Mozilla wants to improve firefox 2.

Read full topic

Codenamed Gran Paradiso, Firefox 3 includes the new Gecko 1.9 rendering
engine which leverages the open-source Cairo rendering framework and
features heavily refactored reflow algorithms that improve Firefox layout
functionality and resolve some long-standing CSS bugs.
